Sentence: However, the tension dissipates when they arrive home and Zeena, Ethan's sickly, shrewish wife, who has kept a late-night vigil in anticipation of their return, greets them

She (wife) regards the dynamic between her (wife) husband and her (wife) cousin with obvious suspicion, and Ethan goes to bed in a state of unease, without a word to Zeena and with thoughts only of Mattie

Catastrophe threatens when the cat shatters Zeena's favorite pickle dish, which Mattie had taken out to celebrate their dinner together, but Ethan quickly pieces the shards together and tucks the broken dish back in its place
When he (Ethan) arrives back at the farm, expecting to find Mattie alone, she (Ethan) informs him (Mattie) that Zeena has returned
Zeena, however, is in no mood for kindnesses and bitterly informs Ethan that her (wife) health is failing rapidly
Ethan privately resents Zeena's decision but keeps the bulk of his (Ethan) anger to himself
Unable to tolerate Mattie's dismissal, but effectively unable to prevent it, Ethan briefly considers eloping with Mattie, and even begins to draft a letter of farewell to Zeena
On his (Mattie) way down the hill Ethan encounters the Hale sleigh, and, in passing, Hale's wife praises him (Ethan) greatly for his (Ethan) patience in caring for the ailing Zeena
Against Zeena's wishes, Ethan decides to bring Mattie to the station himself
